meanings.definition: A long, flexible tube in the body that carries food from the mouth to the stomach.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined her tharm to check for any blockages.
meanings.sent2: After swallowing the food, it travels down the tharm to reach the stomach.
meanings.sent3: The tharm decided to take a detour and lead the food to the heart instead of the stomach!
meanings.sent4: Her tharm was like a winding road, guiding the food through twists and turns.
meanings.sent5: The tharm, like a conveyor belt, efficiently transported the food to its destination.

meanings.definition: To have a strong desire or craving for something.
meanings.sent1: She tharms for chocolate whenever she feels stressed.
meanings.sent2: He tharms to travel to exotic places and explore new cultures.
meanings.sent3: The cat tharmed for attention and purred loudly until it was petted.
meanings.sent4: His tharming for success drove him to work hard and achieve his goals.
meanings.sent5: The child tharms for adventure and eagerly explores the backyard looking for treasures.
